title: log role
description: A type of live region where new information is added in meaningful order and old information may disappear

assertions.title: announce changes to the live region
examples: Screen readers will automatically announce the live region.

assertions.title: convey the implicit aria-live value of polite by not interrupting the current announcement
examples: Screen readers will changes to content within role="log" after other announcements finish.

assertions.title: convey the implicit aria-atomic value of false by only announcing content that has changed
examples: Screen readers will announce all the content within role="log".

assertions.title: convey its name and role as part of the live announcement if it has a name
examples: Screen readers may announce the name and logf role if it has a name from the author (usually via aria-label or aria-labelledby).
The name will be announced before or after the contents of the live region.
The the role will be implied by interruption, or may be explicitly stated as something like "log" or an earcon

assertions.title: convey its name and role while navigating the page if it has a name
examples: Screen readers may announce the name and role if it has a name from the author (usually via aria-label or aria-labelledby). The name and role are usually announced when navigating into the element.
screen readers may convey the role as an earcon.
